title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: plans to celebrate life of murdered mp jo cox revealed .
arson theory over 16,000-hay bale blaze in doncaster .
ban on repeated marches by far right groups in rotherham rejected .
mum-of-four from bradford wins euro millions jackpot .
campaign to save yorkshire dales bus service .

documents.title: driver with 62 points still on the road
text: driver with 62 points still on the road

documents.title: cctv released in pensioner murder probe
text: cctv released in pensioner murder probe

documents.title: cctv lead in pensioner murder inquiry
text: cctv lead in pensioner murder inquiry

documents.title: village taxpayers see council bill hikes
text: village taxpayers see council bill hikes

documents.title: sus death victim is named
text: sus death victim is named

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: thanks for being with us today .
live updates will continue throughout this evening and tonight .
before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :

documents.title: dewsbury sus death victim named
text: a 32-year-old man who died after being found with serious injuries in dewsbury on friday has been named by police as jonathan binns of ings crescent .
mr binns was found in the town , thornhill , dewsbury , after police were called at about 20:40 on friday .
he was taken to hospital but died from his injuries .
a total of nine people aged between 16 and 20-years-old , all from dewsbury , have been arrested in connection with the death of mr binns .
all nine have been released on bail pending further enquiries , police say .

documents.title: yorkshire 's weather forecast
text: tonight it 'll cloud over with rain , locally heavy , spreading from the southwest and a minimum temperature of about 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be mostly cloudy with showers or longer outbreaks of rain , possibly wintry for a time mainly over highest ground .
becoming very windy , with a met office amber `` be prepared '' warning in place with widespread severe westerly gales developing .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : bricks cause bother on a19
text: if you 're on the a19 near york at the moment , you might want to find an alternative route :
1 lane closed # a19 southbound on approach to fulford interchange with # a64 # york as lorry has shed its load of bricks .
traffic is building
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid sorry guys , forgot to tag you in
pontus jansson has been sent for .
going to clear the road by heading them onto the verge .
# magichat
hi there - ok if we use the pic for ?
@ twitterid ta !
no problem
bet the driver 's mortar-fied
`` traffic is building ''
his boss will come down on him like a ton of bricks
traffic is building .
see what you did there .
honest guv , they fell off the back of a lorry
terrifying .
i 'd have been shitting a brick .
bricks in a curtainsider ? looks like that from not a good idea .
@ twitterid @ twitterid has n't he them up yet ? !
that 's terrible ( in the very best kind of way ) !
i see what you did there haha
a reminder that curtains are load covers not load bearing .
( unless load bearing curtains )
bet the driver is bricking it
starting the house in the wrong shot ,
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: happy ending for leeds dog abandoned on valentines day
text: there 's a happy ending for a dog left scared and alone in leeds on valentine 's day .
the one-year-old crossbreed was found tied to a gate at east end park in cross green , with a note round her neck saying `` i am lara '' .
now , i 'm pleased to report that someone 's come forward to offer her a new home .
a family came up at the weekend to meet her and fell in love . ''
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: skipton fraud investigation : do you know this man ?
text: detectives in north yorkshire are asking for people 's help in identifying a man shown in a cctv image who they want to talk to as part of a fraud investigation .
a fraudulent cheque for £ 3,600 was cashed at the town 's natwest bank on 11 april 2016 .
the following day , an attempt to cash another cheque , this time for for £ 8,800 , was made , but failed .
officers are appealing for anyone who can help identify the man in the cctv image to contact them .

documents.title: arson theory over 16,000-hay bale blaze in doncaster
text: arson is now thought to be the cause of a major blaze at a farm near doncaster which started last night and which firefighters are still tackling .
fire crews were called to the blaze at bay villa farm on sorrell lane at fishlake at about 19:00 on tuesday evening .
they found about 16,000 hay bales well alight .
it 's thought firefighters could now have to stay at the site for up to a week .
simon rogers , from south yorkshire fire service , says : `` we do think the fire may have been started deliberately .
we 've had fire investigations carried out last night and today and that 's looking like the most probable cause . ''

documents.title: listen : sheffield air raid to be investigated - over 100 years later
text: a project in sheffield has been awarded just over £ 28,000 by the heritage lottery fund to investigate the city 's first ever air raid .
the sheffield zeppelin study group focuses on the september 1916 airship attack which killed and injured nearly 50 people and left the city traumatised for years to come .
those involved in the project hope to find out the reasons the city was so unprepared for the attack , and discover more about families of the people killed and injured .
these people witnessed the event themselves , and back in 1981 they told a sheffield archives team what it was like :

documents.title: petition launched to return 'racist ' t-shirt to primark stores
text: a petition has been launched to return a `` racist '' walking dead t-shirt to primark stores after a sheffield methodist minister 's complaint saw the garment pulled from shelves .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: cctv appeal over bus stop attack
text: police in doncaster investigating an assault on a 14-year-old boy last month have released cctv images of a man they want to speak to in connection with the incident .
the boy was attacked at a bus stop in urban road , hexthorpe , at about 08:25 on tuesday 31 january .
he suffered a minor head injury which did n't require hospital treatment .
a number of other children were also at the bus stop at the time but were not injured , police say .
detectives believe the man could hold vital information and want anyone who recognises him to get in touch .

documents.title: campaign to save yorkshire dales bus service
text: an online crowdfunding campaign which was set up to help save a north yorkshire bus service made famous when it featured on a bbc `` slow tv '' show has now reached £ 400 .
the volunteer-run northern dalesman `` country bus '' , which links richmond to swaledale and hawes , featured in the bbc 4 programme all aboard !
the country bus , which last year attracted about one million viewers .
the yorkshire dales society , which funds the service , is trying to raise £ 3,000 to ensure it can continue .
society member colin speakman says it 's not just a service for local residents : `` it 's good for the area .
it brings visitors in and visitors spend money .
so , it 's helping the area economically . ''

documents.title: police launch gun and knife amnesty in west yorkshire
text: a knives and gun amnesty 's been launched by west yorkshire police today , in a bid to remove them from the county 's streets .
the campaign 's backed by father-of-three christopher wright , who was left fighting for his life after being gunned down on the doorstep of his leeds home in april 2010 .
he spent weeks in intensive care and lost his business and almost his family home .
police say a similar scheme last year led to 150 bladed and offensive weapons and 80 guns being handed in .
our lives were devastated by what happened and i would not want that to happen to any other family .
i would urge them to support the weapons surrender . ''

documents.title: looking for friends ? you 'll find them in sheffield
text: `` oh .
my god ``
almost 13 years after the final episode aired , legendary tv sitcom friends returns to yorkshire once again this summer as part of a 12-week tour of the uk .
friendsfest allows fans to visit specially recreated sets , grab a coffee at central perk and recreate the show 's iconic opening titles - umbrellas and all .
after the success of last year 's visit to harewood house in leeds , the tour will this year come to sheffield with new york taking over hillsborough park between 7-16 july .
could you be any more excited ?

documents.title: owner of brighouse ritz urged to fight name battle
text: the owner of the ritz ballroom in brighouse has been urged not to give up his fight to keep the name the venue 's had since 1937 .
the ritz has been ordered to change its name or face legal action by the owners of the famous london hotel .
glenn smith , who runs it , received a letter demanding he rename the music venue and surrender a number of internet and social media accounts .
but he 's been urged by the owner of the kettering ritz , who 's been through the same thing , not to give up .
i said : 'i 'm not going to take this lying down ' .
there 's no way i 'm going to give up this fight , i 'm going to keep the name the ritz .
and that 's what i did . ''

documents.title: north yorkshire police 's storm doris 'stay safe ' warning
text: while west yorkshire fire service has already warned us about the risk of fly-away trampolines as we prepare for storm doris , north yorkshire police and the county 's fire service have now issued their own warnings :
# stormdoris bringing high winds & heavy rain to # northyorks overnight .
stay safe & drive according to conditions see @ twitterid for updates
there 's a chance of strong winds and rain tonight from # stormdoris so might be worth checking items in the garden are secure .

documents.title: home office rejects protest law change
text: home office rejects protest law change

documents.title: listen : jobs could go at south yorkshire police after funding cut
text: more job losses could be on the way for south yorkshire police after the government announced a £ 2.5m reduction in its budget for this year .
the force says cuts will have to be made in officers and support staff after getting just over £ 99m - that 's £ 2.5m less than the previous year .
sheffield central labour mp paul blomfield thinks the reductions are shortsighted :

documents.title: sat nav causes lorry to get stuck near sowerby bridge
text: if you 've been stuck in a queue near sowerby bridge in west yorkshire , this is why :
this lorry got stuck coming out of water hill lane , causing long delays on the a646 in both directions .
the driver says his sat nav took him down the road and the back of his truck got caught on the tarmac .

documents.title: listen : spectre of relegation looms for minstermen
text: york city are six points adrift of safety after last night 's 3-1 home defeat to gateshead .
the fixture was city 's game in hand on the teams around them and many fans saw it as a must-win .
the loss means the minstermen have just one league win in 2017 and just five league wins all season - leaving them second-bottom of the national league .
manager gary mills questioned the mental strength of some of his players after the disappointing result :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: primark pulls 'fantastically offensive ' walking dead t-shirt
text: primark has stopped selling a t-shirt featuring words from a nursery rhyme after a shopper in sheffield complained it was `` fantastically offensive '' .
the t-shirt in question is licensed merchandise from the walking dead and features the rhyme `` eeny meeny miny moe '' , which has a racist origin .
customer ian lucraft , who complained about the top to primark , had been in a sheffield branch of the store with his wife gwen when they spotted the item of clothing .
but now there 's a backlash on social media , with some complaining it 's an example of customers being `` over-sensitive '' .

documents.title: storm doris : strongest gusts over parts of west and south yorkshire
text: i 've just spotted this from the met office about tomorrow 's expected winds - and it looks like the worst of them will be over south yorkshire and parts of west yorkshire .
we could see windspeeds of around 80mph on higher ground tomorrow as storm doris sweeps in from the west .
we can also expect a lot of rain tomorrow , with the worst of the winds being with us in the afternoon .
on a lighter note , west yorkshire fire and rescue are already urging people to make sure their trampolines are tied down :
# stormdoris is on her way !
there is an amber warning for wind tomorrow with gusts of up to 80mph expected !
tie down your trampolines !
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: it 's all getting tight at the top of the championship
text: yorkshire has four teams in the top 10 on the championship table with huddersfield knocking on the door of the automatic promotion places after last night 's win at home to reading .
the terriers moved back to within four points of the automatic promotion places in the championship as philip billing 's late winner was enough to beat rivals reading .
this weekend fifth place leeds face sixth-placed sheffield wednesday in a yorkshire derby , meaning either could move up to just behind huddersfield .
but let 's all try and keep calm , there 's still plenty of chance for this table to change completely :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: lottery winner to stay in shipley
text: a bradford mum-of-four who has scooped the euro millions jackpot says she will stay in shipley .
beverley doran won £ 14.5m on friday 's draw and says she jumped out of bed when she found out she had won .
she has also been describing how she made the call to camelot after she received an email telling her that she had won , but put the phone down worrying that it may have been a scam .
she has also talked about how she went to harrogate after finding out she won and drinking a £ 25 bottle of wine in a posh restaurant , something she 's never done .
she 'd better get used to it now
i come from a council estate in a three-bedroomed house with five of us , so it 's pretty cramped .
so for them to have their own rooms will be nice , but i 'm not moving far . ''

documents.title: harrogate teenager luke is 'power mad '
text: most days i can barely raise a sweat let alone heavy weights so i was impressed today meeting harrogate teenager luke richardson .
luke , 19 , is a powerlifter who has already broken a number of records despite having competed in the discipline for just a year .
he 's currently preparing to compete in the european power lifting championships in thisted , denmark .
the championships start on 12 march , so luke is putting in extra shifts at his gym in boroughbridge and this morning i went along to see how his training is going :
author: Jericho Keys
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: police warning over stolen medication
text: south yorkshire police have issued a public warning after controlled drugs were stolen from a pharmacy in rossington , doncaster .
weldricks pharmacy on green lane was burgled on monday .
police are urging people in the area not to take any medication that has not been prescribed to them , as it could have serious health implications .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stormy night ahead for yorkshire
text: batten down the hatches and get ready :
afternoon storm doris is due to arrive on thursday and an amber warning for wind has been issued .
the rain will start tonight and continue for several hours .
the wind tomorrow may get up to 80mph gusts on higher ground .
be prepared for storm doris , secure loose items as it is expected that gusts of 80mph may affect the district .
no warning for rain has been issued but it 's expected that there may be some localised flood issues .
no river flood alerts have been issued .
good morning we are here monitoring the weather and ready to assist bradford residents .
think ebg will stay in cave just # lurking !

documents.title: more cuts in council services expected for leeds
text: more cuts to council services in leeds are expected to be approved later with officials proposing to put council tax up by just under 5 % - 3 % of that will be spent on providing social care .
almost 500 jobs are also expected to be lost over the next year as the council makes savings of £ 25m .
professor tony travers is from the london school of economics :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hearn : 'timing right ' for bramall lane to host kell brook fight
text: boxing promoter eddie hearn says negotiations with sheffield united over a deal to host kell brook 's ibf world welterweight title defence in may have been positive .
it 's been confirmed brook will defend his title against american errol spence jr. in his home city :
hearn says `` the timing 's right '' :
author: Shamir Masri
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: freight container future for york street ?
text: plans for freight containers to be used to create a temporary community project in york have moved a step closer .
spark york has submitted a proposal to create a unique space on piccadilly which would be home to a community of local independent retailers , street food traders and local enterprises .
the idea was first mooted in november last year and caused controversy because of the plan to use freight containers as building material .
if permission is granted by city of york council , the developers would be under notice to quit if new plans for the site emerge .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: yorkshire 's ex-england seamer sidebottom to retire at end of season
text: yorkshire seamer ryan sidebottom has announced he will retire at the end of the forthcoming county season .
the 39-year-old left-armer played 22 tests for england , also winning the icc world twenty20 title with them in 2010 .
he also won five county championship titles , three with his native yorkshire and two with nottinghamshire .
`` there 's a tear in my eye whenever i think about not playing professional cricket again - a game that 's given me so much over the years , '' he said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shipley mum-of-four 'fell to the floor ' after lotto win
text: more on the news that a mum-of-four from bradford has won £ 14.5m on the euro millions lottery .
beverley doran , from shipley , says she `` fell to the floor '' when she found out she 'd won the jackpot prize .
the 37-year-old currently lives in a council house but says she 'll be buying her first family home with the money .
she had already won £ 50 on a draw earlier in the week and says it took a very long time for it to sink in .
her mum even thought it might be a scam .
we 're told that she 's allergic to champagne , so let 's hope that she can celebrate in style !

documents.title: mum-of-four from bradford wins euro millions jackpot
text: a west yorkshire mum-of-four has scooped the euro millions jackpot , it 's been revealed .
she has n't been officially named as yet but what we do know is that she 's from the bradford district and has won £ 14.5m in last friday 's draw .
we understand she 's now looking forward to buying her first family home .

documents.title: listen : terriers march on towards play-offs
text: huddersfield town took a giant step towards securing at least a place in the championship play-off positions last night , with a 1-0 victory over promotion rivals reading .
the win was the terriers ' 20th victory in just 32 league games , and closes the gap on the automatic promotion places to four points .
danish midfielder phil billing grabbed the decisive goal in the 82nd minute to spare rajiv van la parra 's blushes - he missed a penalty in the first half .
town defender christopher schindler was happy with a victory against a tough side like reading :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : our libraries are `` part of the fabric of life ''
text: back in december , it emerged that north yorkshire county council needed 600 volunteers to help run their libraries .
now it says it needs double that amount .
the reason things are changing is because the council 's library budget has been cut by £ 3.6m over the last five years , but it still wants to keep its libraries open .
with that in mind , i 've been asking my listeners on the bbc radio york mid-morning show when they last used their local library and , in the 21st century , do we really need them ?
york author miles salter gave a strong defence of libraries , saying we 're `` very lucky '' to have them :
author: Jonathan Cowap
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: plea to ban repetitive rotherham protests rejected by home office
text: attempts to ban repeated marches by far right groups in rotherham have been rejected by the home office .
south yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner wanted a change in the law to ban marches on grounds including frequency , cost and community impact .
since 2012 , 16 protests have been held , the majority organized by far right groups such as the edl and britain first , at a cost of £ 4m .
the home office said it had no current plans to change the law .
rotherham council leader chris read says better negotiations are needed before planned demos , in order to reduce the impact on local businesses :

documents.title: doncaster farm fire : 16,000 bales of hay alight
text: this morning we 've been telling you about a huge hay fire in south yorkshire where more than 16,000 bales have been on fire .
if you were wondering what that would look like , take a look at this :
south yorkshire fire and rescue say firefighters were called to sorrell lane , fishlake , in doncaster last night .
the roads around the area are still closed as they damp down .

documents.title: one man went to mow very slowly
text: these days our local councils are facing financial pressures and having to think up lots of ways of saving money .
but it turns out that leeds city council are certainly using their imagination when it comes to counting the pennies .

according to the minutes of the council 's latest budget meeting , its gardeners are to be told to take up `` relaxed mowing '' - which the council believes will help cut costs in the communities and environment department .
as the saying goes you could n't make it up !
now , why have i got the move 's 'i can hear the grass grow ' running through my head ? ?

documents.title: teenage kicks - so hard to beat
text: `` kids these days , eh ? ''
but what is it actually like to be a teenager in 2017 ?
the national citizen service regularly conducts a survey on the subject to help their parents understand them better .

teenagers taking part have created an index of the things they believe all 16 and 17-year-olds should have more freedom to do - including learning to drive , opening up a bank account and voting in elections .
also high on the list are things that previous generations may not have considered like developing skills for their cvs and exploring the world beyond their hometown .

in yorkshire & the humber , 70 % of teenagers believe that their parents or guardians determine how much freedom they have when growing up while 56 % said that they had taken alcohol without parental permission .
meanwhile 66 % of parents believe that the world is a scarier place today than when they were teenagers and 15 % believe that teenagers nowadays have less freedom compared to their generation .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: scrutiny board to look at plans to end waste contract
text: sheffield city council 's scrutiny board is going to take a look at why the council wants to end the waste collection contract with veolia .
the council voted in january to end their current contract with veolia 20 years early and plan to negotiate contracts for each of the different part of the waste service .
but the scrutiny board says that `` a major change to a service used by most households in the city should have scrutiny to ensure full transparency of the decision '' .
veolia 's contract is due to run until 2036 .

documents.title: battle to save the 'country bus '
text: battle to save the 'country bus '

documents.title: listen : 'our country is better than hate-fuelled acts ' - brendan cox
text: people are being encouraged to hold and street parties to mark the first anniversary of the death of yorkshire politician jo cox .
the batley and spen mp was murdered in birstall in june 2016 .
mrs cox 's husband , brendan , says he wants the anniversary events to celebrate his wife 's desire to bring communities together :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: scarborough athletic chairman dies
text: scarborough athletic chairman dave holland has died after a short battle with illness .
holland was admitted to intensive care in a critical condition on monday but died yesterday afternoon .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: weapons amnesty in west yorkshire
text: west yorkshire police are running a weapons amnesty to get guns and knives off the streets .
anyone handing in a weapon over the next 10 days will not face prosecution .
when a similar event took place last year 150 knives and offensive weapons were handed in , as well as 80 guns .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: councils ' bird control costs continue to rise
text: the amount spent on trying to get rid of pigeons and gulls has almost doubled in the last three years .
the bbc has obtained responses from about two thirds of councils after an information request on bird control .
since 2013 , scarborough borough council has spent just under £ 11,000 while the city of york council shelled out £ 9,000 .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic and travel update : a1 fully open at catterick
text: the a1 southbound at catterick north had a lane closed due to a jacknifed lorry earlier this morning but this has now re-opened .
however the area still has traffic queues and long delays should be expected for a while .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: doncaster farm fire : 8,000 tonnes of hay destroyed
text: eight thousand tonnes of hay have been destroyed in a large fire at a farm near doncaster this morning .
fire crews are dealing with the incident at bay villa farm .
sorrell lane is still closed as a result of the blaze .

documents.title: traffic and travel : disruption on the a1
text: there is one lane closed , queueing traffic and long delays on the a1 southbound between a6136 gatherley road ( catterick north ) and a6136 leeming lane ( catterick south )
this is due to a jacknifed lorry going into the central reservation .
congestion is backing up all the way to a66/a6108 scotch corner .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cemetery crackdown on decorations
text: councillors are to decide what to do about memorial decorations at a cemetery in scarborough - some of which could breach the rules .
people have been placing wind chimes as well as glass or porcelain containers on graves or memorial plaques .
hanging decorations have also been found on trees at woodlands cemetery .
borough councillors are considering putting up notices on key dates such as mother 's or father 's day and christmas to remind people of the restrictions .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sleep deprivation is difficult to ig-snore
text: it 's claimed more than a quarter of people in yorkshire are relying on alcohol to get to sleep .
the sleep council , based in skipton , also says fewer of us are sharing the bed with our partners in a bid to get a good night 's sleep .
their findings also suggest just under a third of people are only getting five to six hours of sleep a night - below their recommended amount of seven hours .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: home office : no extra powers to ban rotherham edl march
text: the home office says there 's no plans to give extra powers to south yorkshire police to ban edl marches from rotherham .
it comes ahead of another march planned in the town for saturday .
in 2015 , south yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner dr alan billings wrote to government ministers to ask for powers to curb such protests in specific circumstances :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : can volunteers save our libraries ?
text: north yorkshire county council officials say they 're confident all the libraries will remain open once they 're being staffed by volunteers .
the council is in the middle of implementing £ 3.6m budget cuts for libraries - changing the way the service is run .
from april this year 20 libraries will be run by local community groups .
helmsley library 's manager jeanne brown says they need at least another 10 volunteers but remain determined to keep the service open :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crews dealing with major fire at doncaster farm
text: firefighters are still at the scene of a major fire involving 6,000 bales of hay at a doncaster farm this morning .
the fire started about 19:00 last night at bay villa farm on sorrell lane , fishlake .
south yorkshire fire service says the blaze is still alight but under control and firefighters are expected to remain at the scene for the next couple of days .
firefighters from thorne and askern attended the incident with support from neighbouring fire services at goole and snaith .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jo cox : details of a celebration of the murdered mp 's life to be announced
text: the duchess of cornwall is due to announce more details later about plans to celebrate the life of west yorkshire mp jo cox .
she was murdered in birstall last year as she prepared to hold a constituency surgery at the local library .
a weekend of community get-togethers and street parties has already been announced for june .
the mp 's sister , kim leadbeater , says the idea is to celebrate what people have in common :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your weather this wednesday morning
text: here 's abbie dewhurst with the weather forecast for wednesday :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: yorkshire sport latest this morning
text: huddersfield town took a giant step towards securing at least a place in the championship playoff positions , with a 1-0 victory over fellow promotion rivals reading last night .
danish midfielder philip billing ( nabbed the winner with eight minutes left to play .
sheffield wednesday 's winning run came to an end last night as they lost 1-2 at home to brentford .
york city remain in the relegation mire in the national league after their 1-3 defeat at home to gateshead .
the minstermen are six points adrift of safety and have just one league win in 2017 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: lane closed on m1 at j29a
text: one lane closed due to accident , two cars involved on m1 southbound at j29a markham lane ( markham vale / bolsover ) .
traffic is coping well .
lane one ( of four ) is closed .
incident was initially reported at j29 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest headlines from newsrooms across yorkshire include :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: i 'll be with you until 14:00 with all the latest news , travel and weather from across yorkshire .
we 'd love to see your like this wintry shot taken at grassington by bbc weather watcher rambling rose .
you can get in touch and send your photos via twitter , facebook or email .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live
